tasks

Class MandelBrotTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • api.Task
      • tasks.MandelBrotTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class MandelBrotTask
extends Task
implements java.io.Serializable
    This task generates an int matrix with the results of a Mandelbrot set.
    Author:
    klopker
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • MandelBrotTask

        public MandelBrotTask(double x,
              double y,
              double edge,
              int n,
              int max_k)
        This task helps produce a visualization of the some part of the Mandelbrot set.
        Parameters:
        x - Lower x of the complex plane
        y - Lower y of the complex plane
        edge - Represents the edge length of a square in the complex plane, whose sides are parallel to the axes.
        n - an int such that the square region of the complex plane is subdivided into n X n squares, each of which is visualized by 1 pixel.
        max_k - an int which is the iteration limit: It defines when the representative point of a region is considered to be in the Mandelbrot set.

    • Method Detail

      • execute

        public Result execute()
        Generates the Mandelbrot set and returns a matrix with ints from 0 to max_k.
        Specified by:
        execute in class Task
        Returns:
        MandelbrotSetTask with the result filled out: A matrix where int[i][j] = k in the Mandelbrot set.
